semantic_identifier: 57: fix: Normalize experiment funnel stages/events for consistent outcome tracking across sources

sections.text:
## Description

This PR fixes inconsistent outcome metrics (win rate, pipeline velocity, conversion) for messaging experiments by introducing a single normalization layer that maps source-specific CRM stages and product events into a canonical set of funnel stages used by experiment analytics.

Implementation (high level):
- Adds a canonical funnel stage model (e.g., enum/consts) and a source-aware mapping table for:
  - CRM stage names/IDs -> canonical funnel stage
  - Product event names/properties -> canonical funnel stage
- Applies normalization at ingestion:
  - Persists normalized_stage (and the original raw stage/event for traceability).
  - Ensures the same source payload always yields the same normalized funnel stage.
- Applies the same normalization in query/aggregation code paths:
  - Analytics queries aggregate on normalized_stage instead of raw stage/event fields.
  - Backwards compatibility is preserved by falling back to raw values only when no mapping exists.
- Adds/updates tests covering:
  - Known CRM stage variants (case, whitespace, synonyms) mapping to the same canonical stage.
  - Product event variants mapping to the expected canonical stage.
  - A regression test verifying stable metrics for the same experiment when sourced from CRM vs product events.

Notes:
- This is a low-risk change intended to stabilize metrics; it does not alter experiment definitions, only how stages/events are interpreted.
- Any previously unmapped stage/event will remain visible in raw fields and can be added to the mapping table without code changes.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
